doc.source_uri: 2026-12-31/Industrial and Commercial Bank of China - H First Take 2Q25 revenue and PPOP beat expectations with strong non-fee incom_2026-12-31

passages.text: First Take: 2Q25 revenue and PPPO beat expectations with strong non- fee income growth

Our First Take: 2Q25 print beats. Net profit \(+1\%\) y/y (2ppt below JPME), up from \(- 4\%\) y/y in 1Q25. More importantly, revenue and PPoP respectively up \(7\%\) y/y, beat JPME by 4ppt (Table 2). This was mainly driven by resilient NII \((+3\%\) y/y) and robust non- fee income \((+73\%\) y/y). Asset quality remains stable with a moderate rise in provision level. We expect a positive stock reaction post the 2Q print.

- NII is resilient despite NIM contraction (-6bps q/q): 2Q25 NII growth turned positive \((+3\%\) y/y vs 1Q25 \(-3\%\) y/y), due to rise in interest-earning assets and narrowing NIM contraction (2Q25 -11bps y/y vs 1Q25 -15bps y/y). For details on NIM, please refer to Table 4.
- Robust non-NII income: Non-NII income grew by \(21\%\) y/y in 2Q, driven mainly by investment income (other income \(+73\%\) y/y), while fee income was flat y/y (vs -1% y/y in 1Q).
- Asset quality was stable: The NPL ratio was flat q/q, SML -12bps h/h, and the NPL coverage ratio edged up 2ppt q/q to 217.7.3%. Please refer to Table 5 for details by sector breakdown.
- OPEX \(+5\%\) y/y: This is 3ppt higher than JPME.
- We expect upward revisions of low single digit percentage points on FY25 earnings.
- We expected a positive share price reaction given strong revenue and PPoP growth, and profit growth turning positive.
Table 1: Summary of 1H25 results

Investment Thesis- The past decade record shows that ICBC offers lower EPS and DPS volatility than the sector average.- ICBC shows lower downside risks to tariff wars, compared to peers.- We believe ICBC will see lower dilution risk than SOE peers in the event of a capital injection.- The dividend is a key support in the medium term. We believe downside to DPS is limited as ICBC could release provisions to offset the potential negative factors such as additional asymmetrical rate cuts, mortgage refinancing at lower rates, or a rise in the NPL formation ratio

Our Dec- 26 PT of HK\$7.20 is based on DDM, using a cost of equity of \(11.25\%\) , a normalized ROE of \(9.1\%\) and a terminal date of 31 December 2027. We derive the valuation for the A- share first and then apply an H- share discount of \(- 22\%\) .
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.
Key assumptions/parametersNormalized ROE9.1%Cost of capital11.25%Long-term growth4.5%Fair terminal P/BV0.69Dec-26 A-share PT (Rmb)8.50CNYHKD1.09H-share discount-22%Dec-26 H-share PT (HK$)7.20

The chart(s) show J.P. Morgan's continuing coverage of the stocks; the current analysts may or may not have covered it over the entire period. J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: OW = Overweight, N= Neutral, UW = Underweight, NR = Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex- Australia and ex- India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
